other_tests.findings: Multiple intracardiac masses involving the right ventricle, right atrium, septum, and possibly the left ventricle, consistent with rhabdomyomas.
Attenuation of the background amplitude and slowing in the left hemisphere, with focal spikes in the right temporal region.
Enlarged kidneys with multiple simple cysts, larger than normal for the patientâ€™s age.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeat renal ultrasonography revealed enlarging, multicystic kidneys at 6 months of age (right kidney, 14.8 cm; left kidney, 15.7 cm).

other_tests.findings: Multiple subependymal nodules along the lateral ventricular margins and cortical tubers
other_tests.changes_over_time: Serial MRI revealed stable cerebral tubers over time.

other_tests.findings: Numerous cysts throughout both kidneys; largest cyst approximately 10.5 cm; a slightly complex cyst in the lower pole of the left kidney had a thin septation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 6 years 8 months of age, the complex cyst showed an irregular solid enhancing component and increased in size.

other_tests.findings: Diagnosis of renal-cell carcinoma with papillary and oncocytic features.
Diagnosis of renal-cell carcinoma with papillary and oncocytic features.
